props.allowedDates: Restricts which dates can be selected
props.allowOverflow: Allows the menu to overflow off the screen
props.attach: Specifies which DOM element that this component should detach to. String can be any valid querySelector and Object can be any valid Node. will attach to the root body by default.
props.contentClass: Applies a custom class to the detached element. This is useful because the content is moved to the beginning of body (unless the attach prop is provided) and is not targetable by classes passed directly on the component.
props.format: Allows you to customize input date format
props.formatHeader: Allows you to customize header date format
props.fullscreenMobile: Shows datepicker in a bottom sheet when in mobile view
props.maxDate: Dates are disabled after this date
props.minDate: Dates are availables after this date
props.mobileBreakpoint: Used to set when to toggle between normal datepicker & fullscreen datepicker. Used with fullscreenMobile prop
props.name: Sets input name property & datepicker title in fullscreenMobile
props.range: Sets range mode active (currently, only available for date)
props.rangePresets: Allows to add custom range presets to range datepicker. (Max custom presets = 6) Example: [{ name: 'This year', dates: { start: ..., end: ... } }]
props.type: Determines the type of the picker - date/month/quarter
props.validate: Shows validation buttons to select date
props.value: Date picker model (ISO 8601 format, YY-mm-dd or YY-mm)
props.visible: Allows you to trigger datepicker visibility
props.visibleYearsNumber: Sets years range in year selection panel (it'll see X years before and after current year)
